Home  Government  Mayor & City Council

Mayor & City Council


  • Agendas are prepared in advance by the presiding officer (Mayor) and posted per the Texas Open Meetings Act requirements, 3 business days, before a regular scheduled meeting.
  • A Council Member can request for consideration an item to be on an agenda through the City Manager or Mayor.
  • A citizen can request for consideration an item to be on an agenda by contacting a current Council Member, or by speaking with the City Manager, who will in turn discuss with the Mayor who will decide if it needs to be an agenda item.
  • Citizens can address the Council, on non-agenda items, during the "Citizen Comments" portion of the meeting. They must sign the non-agenda form furnished by the city prior to the meeting in order to speak.  Citizens may speak three (3) minutes each on matters, other than personnel, concerning the City on a first-come, first-serve basis. City of Combine action in response to, or as a result of, such statements may not be undertaken until such matters are placed on a City Council agenda published in accordance with Texas Open Meetings Act, and acted upon accordingly at such meeting.
